Detailed Description

BTConnection class is the child of the Connection class used for Bluetooth communitcation.

This is the Bluetooth version of the Connection class. It uses the same Direct messages as USBConnection. Except that it first sends a 2 byte packet containing the length of the packet about to be sent. See the USBConnection class for more documentation.

It should be 100% functional when it is cast to a connection or vice versa....

See also:
Connection
USBConnection

void BTConnection::closeSensorOnPort ( unsigned char  port  )  [inline, virtual]

Close any sensor on the NXT.

Close any type of sensor at the specified port on the NXT.

Parameters:
port The port to close the NXT on.

Implementation

In the Connection class this does nothing.

Reimplemented from Connection.

int BTConnection::getBumperValue ( unsigned char  port  )  [inline, virtual]

Retrieve an bumper value from the NXT.

Tell the NXT to return the newest bumper value from the bumper sensor at the specified port.

Parameters:
port The port to read from.
Returns:
returns bumper value(1,0).

Implementation

In the Connection class this allways returns -1.

Reimplemented from Connection.

Returns:
returns light value(0-100).

Bluetooth Connection Function.

This is a function to open a bluetooth connection. Coppied from Vikram Aggarwal's BT sample code.

bool BTConnection::nxt_connect (  )  [inline, virtual]

Connect to NXT.

Connection function to link to the NXT, this must be called before any other communication can happen.

Returns:
1 for connected, 0 for error.

Implementation

In the Connection class this function allways returns false or not connected.

Reimplemented from Connection.

void BTConnection::nxt_set_motor ( int  speed,
int  motor 
) [inline, virtual]

Set the speed of a given motor.

Send a speed value to a specified motor that will set that motor to that speed till a new value is recieved.

Parameters:
speed The speed value to send to the motor (0-100).
motor The motor port #(0,1,2 or FF for all 3).

Implementation

In the Connection class this does nothing.

Reimplemented from Connection.

void BTConnection::nxt_set_motor_with_limit ( int  speed,
int  limit,
int  motor 
) [inline, virtual]

Set the speed of a given motor for a given time.

Send a speed value to a specified motor that will set that motor to that speed for the specifed number of rotations.

Parameters:
speed The speed value to send to the motor (0-100).
limit The number of degrees to turn before the wheel stops (360 = 1 rotation)(0-FFFF).
motor The motor port #(0,1,2 or FF for all 3).

Implementation

In the Connection class this does nothing.

Reimplemented from Connection.

void BTConnection::openLightActiveOnPort ( unsigned char  port  )  [inline, virtual]

Add a active light sensor to NXT.

void BTConnection::setSonorContinuousReadMode ( unsigned char  port  )  [inline, virtual]

Set the Sonar to read continuously.

Tell the NXT to allways read sonar values while it is running, instead of only when a new value is requested.

Parameters:
port The port to set continous read mode on.

Implementation

In the Connection class this does nothing.

Reimplemented from Connection.
